titleStmt.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1918 Sept. 1

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

bibl.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1918 Sept. 1

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson Tennessee
U.S.A.
Over There
Sept 1 1918
Dear Ellen:
Another week and another letter from you. Well I thank I am doing fine now But it is older than the one I received last week. I like to get them even if they are two months old.

I am feeling fine and dandy hope you are also. It has been trying to rain all day. But I hope it fails Has turned cold again or colder than it was yesterday.I have quit ever thinking of such a thing as hot weather.
Well I have just finished My dinner. Guess you have just had breakfast as I am
six hours ahead of you. So when supper time comes I would like to be there to take dinner with you. Ah well I bet I would be out of luck if I was there
Can just see Bob drive up in his new car. And walk straight in. Those are awful dreams did you ever have them?
Well tomorrow is Labor Day what are they going to have in Jackson? I bet not murch of anything
Guess I will work I havent heard yet. You know there is no such a thing as Labor day over here
Well dont make murch difference to me I am trying to catch up with my letter writing to day. Have been writing all day you know when I get a few letter I have to write a hole day to catch up.
But I sure do like to get them so I have to write or guess every body would stop writing to me.
Old possom (Jno Cortmell) has been writing all day So I guess he is behind too I dont know what I would do if it wasnt for him, to pick at.

We have another fellow with us that is a real good friend of mine. His name is D.A.Cooper and he keeps life in the hole bunch. Alway picking at some one. If he comes in a little late at night. He has got to come around and wake up every body, and ask them a bunch of foolish questions.
You can just amagin hw a bunch of boys are. You should here how they are arguering now A fellow cant write with any sence
How does Harold like the army life by this time? I know he is having to drill some I have been along there.
I am going to send you a paper that is published over here. It is a weekly paper you can look at it and then give it to Aunt Amie to read if she wants to
Dont know any more to write this time Write me real often I enjoy your letters so murch
with love
James L Dodds
Co L 23 Engrs
American Exp Force
Via N.Y. France
